meanings.definition: To rouse to action or effort; stir up; arouse.
meanings.sent1: The coach's inspiring speech bestirred the team to victory.
meanings.sent2: She bestirred herself early in the morning to start her day.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow bestirred the dog from its nap.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news bestirred a sense of urgency in the town.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the alarm clock bestirred him from his deep sleep.

meanings.definition: To cause to move or act; stir.
meanings.sent1: The wind bestirred the leaves on the trees.
meanings.sent2: He bestirred the crowd with his powerful speech.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies bestirred her from her study.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the music bestirred memories of his childhood.
meanings.sent5: The energetic dance bestirred the audience to join in.
